dataDictionary.Title: PDS4 Data Dictionary
dataDictionary.Description: This document is a dump of the contents of the PDS4 Data Dictionary

class.title: Axis_Bin_Set_Energy
class.description: The Axis_Bin_Set_* classes describe the spectral characteristics of each band along the spectral dimension of the data object. This will be a literal "axis" in the case of 2D and 3D spectral arrays, or the "Row" axis of a spectral table (each row is a spectral bin), or the "Field" axis of table containing one spectrum per row. These classes are used in cases where the spectral information is not uniform along the spectral dimension.

class.title: Axis_Bin_Set_Frequency
class.description: The Axis_Bin_Set_* classes describe the spectral characteristics of each band along the spectral dimension of the data object. This will be a literal "axis" in the case of 2D and 3D spectral arrays, or the "Row" axis of a spectral table (each row is a spectral bin), or the "Field" axis of table containing one spectrum per row. These classes are used in cases where the spectral information is not uniform along the spectral dimension.

class.title: Axis_Bin_Set_Wavelength
class.description: The Axis_Bin_Set_* classes describe the spectral characteristics of each band along the spectral dimension of the data object. This will be a literal "axis" in the case of 2D and 3D spectral arrays, or the "Row" axis of a spectral table (each row is a spectral bin), or the "Field" axis of table containing one spectrum per row. These classes are used in cases where the spectral information is not uniform along the spectral dimension.

class.title: Axis_Bin_Set_Wavenumber
class.description: The Axis_Bin_Set_* classes describe the spectral characteristics of each band along the spectral dimension of the data object. This will be a literal "axis" in the case of 2D and 3D spectral arrays, or the "Row" axis of a spectral table (each row is a spectral bin), or the "Field" axis of table containing one spectrum per row. These classes are used in cases where the spectral information is not uniform along the spectral dimension.

class.title: Bin_Center_Lookup
class.description: The Bin_Center_Lookup class provides a link to a map or list of bin center values - either to a field in a spectral table, or to a distinct data object that is part of the same product, or to a separate PDS product containing the information.

class.title: Bin_Description
class.description: This class groups the various bin description options, allowing a user to choose one.

class.title: Bin_Energy
class.description: The Bin_Energy class specifies the characteristics of an individual bin along a spectral or other binned axis in an Array object, in units of energy.

class.title: Bin_Frequency
class.description: The Bin_Frequency class specifies the characteristics of an individual bin along a spectral or other binned axis in an Array object, in units of frequency.

class.title: Bin_Wavelength
class.description: The Bin_Wavelength class specifies the characteristics of an individual bin along a spectral or other binned axis in an Array object, in units of wavelength.

class.title: Bin_Wavenumber
class.description: The Bin_Wavenumber class specifies the characteristics of an individual bin along a spectral or other binned axis in an Array object, in units of wavenumber.

class.title: Bin_Width_Constant
class.description: The Bin_Width_Constant class is used inside a Bin_Width_Lookup class for those cases where the bin width is either not well known or unknown. It provides a way to specify a nominal constant width or indicate that there is no available information about the bin width. If the bin width is completely unknown, use the appropriate bin_width attribute for the spectral type (frequency, wavelength, wavenumber, or energy), and indicate that it is nil, with a reason of "unknown". When this class is used, a full explanation of the situation should be provided by the bin_width_desc attribute of the parent class.

class.title: Bin_Width_Lookup
class.description: The Bin_Width_Lookup class provides a link to a map or list of bin width values - either to a field in a spectral table, or to a distinct data object that is part of the same product, or to a separate PDS product containing the information.

class.title: Circular_FOV
class.description: The Circular_FOV class contains attributes to describe a circular aperture/field of view.

class.title: Complex_FOV
class.description: The Complex_FOV class is used for apertures (slits) that are not either circular or a simple rectangular shape.

class.title: Field_of_View
class.description: The Field_of_View class is used to describe the field of view corresponding to the spectral data object. This class should describe the aperture or slit used in making the spectral observation, when applicable, as opposed to the theoretical full field of view of a telescope or boresight (which should be defined in a Geometry Dictionary class).

class.title: Filter
class.description: The Filter class identifies the filter associated with a specific band or bin along a spectral axis in an Array object. The filter may be identified by either name, identifier, or number or some combination of these.

class.title: Observation_Parameters
class.description: The Observation_Parameters class collects various values related to the observational circumstances. In general, this class should be present, and all parameters applicable to the situation should be included, even though optional. In some complex cases or for high-level derived products this class may not be applicable, in which case it may be omitted. Use the 'comment' attribute to describe any special circumstances users should be aware of.

class.title: Rectangular_FOV
class.description: This class is used to describe a rectangular (i.e., slit) aperture.

class.title: Spectral_Characteristics
class.description: The Spectral_Characteristics class provides information about the spectral characteristics of a 1D, 2D, or 3D spectral data object. It is note used for tabulated spectra - tables in which each row

class.title: Spectral_Lookup
class.description: The Spectral_Lookup class references either specific Fields included in a spectral table (for 1D and tabulated spectra), or a 2-dimensional lookup map providing spectral characteristics for a corresponding spectral Array object. In the latter case, the referenced lookup map may either be to the referencing product, or an external stand-alone product.

class.title: Uniformly_Sampled_Energy
class.description: The Uniformly_Sampled_Energy class provides attributes describing the spectral characteristics of a named axis of an Array object or the rows or fields of a Table object, in cases where the spectral sampling interval is regular and the sampling parameters are in energy units.

class.title: Uniformly_Sampled_Frequency
class.description: The Uniformly_Sampled_Frequency class provides attributes describing the spectral characteristics of a named axis of an Array object or the rows or fields of a Table object, in cases where the spectral sampling interval is regular and the sampling parameters are in frequency units.

class.title: Uniformly_Sampled_Wavelength
class.description: The Uniformly_Sampled_Wavelength class provides attributes describing the spectral characteristics of a named axis of an Array object or the rows or fields of a Table object, in cases where the spectral sampling interval is regular and the sampling parameters are in wavelength units.

class.title: Uniformly_Sampled_Wavenumber
class.description: The Uniformly_Sampled_Wavenumber class provides attributes describing the spectral characteristics of a named axis of an Array object or the rows or fields of a Table object, in cases where the spectral sampling interval is regular and the sampling parameters are in wavenumber units.

attribute.title: axis_name
attribute.description: The axis_name attribute contains a string that matches the axis_name attribute in the associated array-type spectrum object; or the special values "Field" and "Row" for tabular and tabulated spectra.

attribute.title: axis_name
attribute.description: The axis_name attribute contains a string that matches the axis_name attribute in the associated array-type spectrum object; or the special values "Field" and "Row" for tabular and tabulated spectra.

attribute.title: axis_name
attribute.description: The axis_name attribute contains a string that matches the axis_name attribute in the associated array-type spectrum object; or the special values "Field" and "Row" for tabular and tabulated spectra.

attribute.title: axis_name
attribute.description: The axis_name attribute contains a string that matches the axis_name attribute in the associated array-type spectrum object; or the special values "Field" and "Row" for tabular and tabulated spectra.

attribute.title: bin_center_field_name
attribute.description: The bin_center_field_name must contain the value of a 'name' attribute of a Field defined in the referenced Table object. This named Field contains the bin center information for each row in a 1D spectrum presented in tabular form. It will have units (and possibly offset and scaling factor) as indicated in the Field definition. This will usually be accompanied by a bin_width_field_name.

attribute.title: bin_center_field_number_list
attribute.description: The bin_center_field_number_list attribute is used only in the case of spectra in the format "Tabulated-Flat", where each row of a table contains a spectrum and the spectral points are defined as individual Fields - one Field defined for each point. The format is a parenthesized, ordered list of the field_number values from the Field definitions that correspond to the bin center values.

attribute.title: bin_profile_description
attribute.description: The bin_profile_description attributes provides a text description of the method used to determine or otherwise define the bin widths following. The description should include information on the shape (e.g. gaussian, square wave, etc.) and what the bin_width value means (i.e., standard deviation of a gaussian function or full-width at half max (FWHM)).

attribute.title: bin_sequence_number
attribute.description: The bin_sequence_number provides the sequential numbering of bins along an axis in an Array object.

attribute.title: bin_width_energy
attribute.description: The bin_width_energy attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in energy units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: center_energy
attribute.description: The center_energy attribute provides the value at the center of a bin along the band axis of a spectral data object. When describing data from a spectrometer, the value corresponds to the peak of the response function for a particular detector and/or grating.

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: detector_number
attribute.description: The detector_number attribute provides the spectrometer detector number corresponding to a band of a spectral qube. Detector numbers are usually assigned consecutively from 1, in order of increasing wavelength.

attribute.title: grating_position
attribute.description: The grating_position attribute of a spectral cube describes the grating position which corresponds to the band. Grating positions are usually assigned consecutively from 0, and increasing position causes increasing wavelength for each detector.

attribute.title: bin_sequence_number
attribute.description: The bin_sequence_number provides the sequential numbering of bins along an axis in an Array object.

attribute.title: bin_width_frequency
attribute.description: The bin_width_frequency attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in frequency units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: center_frequency
attribute.description: The center_frequency attribute provides the value at the center of a bin along the band axis of a spectral data object. When describing data from a spectrometer, the value corresponds to the peak of the response function for a particular detector and/or grating.

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: detector_number
attribute.description: The detector_number attribute provides the spectrometer detector number corresponding to a band of a spectral qube. Detector numbers are usually assigned consecutively from 1, in order of increasing wavelength.

attribute.title: grating_position
attribute.description: The grating_position attribute of a spectral cube describes the grating position which corresponds to the band. Grating positions are usually assigned consecutively from 0, and increasing position causes increasing wavelength for each detector.

attribute.title: bin_sequence_number
attribute.description: The bin_sequence_number provides the sequential numbering of bins along an axis in an Array object.

attribute.title: bin_width_wavelength
attribute.description: The bin_width_wavelength attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in wavelength units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.
attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

attribute.title: center_wavelength
attribute.description: The center_wavelength attribute provides the value at the center of a bin along the band axis of a spectral data object. When describing data from a spectrometer, the value corresponds to the peak of the response function for a particular detector and/or grating.
attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: bin_sequence_number

The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: center_wavenumber
attribute.description: The center_wavenumber attribute provides the value at the center of a bin along the band axis of a spectral data object. When describing data from a spectrometer, the value corresponds to the peak of the response function for a particular detector and/or grating.

attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.description: The bin_width_energy attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in energy units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: bin_width_frequency
attribute.description: The bin_width_frequency attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in frequency units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: bin_width_wavelength
attribute.description: The bin_width_wavelength attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in wavelength units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.
attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

attribute.title: bin_width_wavenumber
attribute.description: The bin_width_wavenumber attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in wavenumber units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: bin_width_field_name
attribute.description: The bin_width_field_name must contain the value of a 'name' attribute of a Field defined in the referenced Table object. This named Field contains the bin width information for each row in a 1D spectrum presented in tabular form. It will have units (and possibly offset and scaling factor) as indicated in the Field definition. This attribute must be accompanied by a bin_center_field_name. If bin widths are constant or unknown, use the Bin_Width_Constant class to specify this.

attribute.title: bin_width_field_number_list
attribute.description: The bin_width_field_number_list attribute is used only in the case of spectra in the format "Tabulated-Flat", where each row of a table contains a spectrum and the spectral points are defined as individual Fields - one Field defined for each point. The format is a parenthesized, ordered list of the field_number values from the Field definitions that correspond to the bin width values. If bin widths are constant or unknown, use the Bin_Width_Constant class to specify this.

attribute.title: diameter_angle
attribute.description: The diameter_angle attribute provides the angle subtended on the sky by the diameter of a circular aperture.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: body_positive_pole_position_angle
attribute.description: The body_positive_pole_position_angle attribute provides the angle the long axis of the slit makes with respect to the positive (or "north") pole of the target body, measured clockwise from the pole in the range 0-180 degrees.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: celestial_north_position_angle
attribute.description: The celestial_north_position_angle attribute provides the angle the long axis of the slit makes with respect to celestial north, measured eastward of celestial north in the range 0-180 degrees.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: length_angle
attribute.description: The length_angle attribute provides the angle subtended on the sky by the long dimension of a simple slit.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: width_angle
attribute.description: The width_angle is the angle subtended on the sky by the short dimension of a simple slit.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: description
attribute.description: The description attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field used specifically for description of circumstances related to the data product of which a user should be aware and might logically expect to find in the label.

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: filter_name
attribute.description: The filter_name attribute provides the commonly-used name of the instrument filter through which an image or measurement was acquired or which is associated with a given instrument mode.

attribute.title: filter_number
attribute.description: The filter_number attribute provides the numeric identifier of an instrument filter through which an image or measurement was acquired or which is associated with a given instrument mode. Within the bin class of a spectral data object, it identifies the filter through which data in the given band were acquired.

attribute.title: absolute_calibration_star_name
attribute.description: The absolute_calibration_star_name attribute provides a name in a standard format (i.e., one that is recognized by the SIMBAD system) for the star used to reduce the raw spectral data to the units presented in this spectrum. This is the analog to solar_calibration_star_name for non-reflectance spectra.

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: net_integration_time
attribute.description: The net_integration_time for a spectrum is the total integration time per pixel. For many detectors (CCDs, for example), all pixels are exposed simultaneously, so this value will correspond to the observation interval. In some cases, however, an instrument will sweep across pixels, rows, or planes, so that the observation period may be substantially longer than the actual integration time contributing to the individual pixels.
attribute.unitId: day, hr, julian day, microseconds, min, ms, s, yr

attribute.title: number_of_exposures
attribute.description: The number_of_exposures attribute indicates how many individual exposures or distinct integrations were combined to produce the spectrum.

attribute.title: resolution_limit_energy
attribute.description: The resolution_limit_energy is the smallest possible distinguishable interval in energy for the instrument.

attribute.title: resolution_limit_frequency
attribute.description: The resolution_limit_frequency is the smallest possible distinguishable interval in frequency for the instrument.

attribute.title: resolution_limit_wavelength
attribute.description: The resolution_limit_wavelength is the smallest possible distinguishable interval in wavelengths for the instrument.
attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

attribute.title: resolution_limit_wavenumber
attribute.description: The resolution_limit_wavenumber is the smallest possible distinguishable interval in wavenumber for the instrument.

attribute.title: solar_analog_star_name
attribute.description: The solar_analog_star_name attribute provides a name in a standard format (i.e., one that is recognized by the SIMBAD system) for the solar analog star used to reduce the raw spectral data to the reflectance units presented in this spectrum.

attribute.title: body_positive_pole_position_angle
attribute.description: The body_positive_pole_position_angle attribute provides the angle the long axis of the slit makes with respect to the positive (or "north") pole of the target body, measured clockwise from the pole in the range 0-180 degrees.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: celestial_north_position_angle
attribute.description: The celestial_north_position_angle attribute provides the angle the long axis of the slit makes with respect to celestial north, measured eastward of celestial north in the range 0-180 degrees.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: length_angle
attribute.description: The length_angle attribute provides the angle subtended on the sky by the long dimension of a simple slit.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: width_angle
attribute.description: The width_angle is the angle subtended on the sky by the short dimension of a simple slit.
attribute.unitId: arcmin, arcsec, deg, hr, mrad, rad

attribute.title: description
attribute.description: The description attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field used specifically for description of circumstances related to the data product of which a user should be aware and might logically expect to find in the label.

attribute.title: spectral_bin_type
attribute.description: The spectral_bin_type attribute contains one of a defined set of values that indicates the binned sampling parameter type (frequency, wavelength, or wavenumber) of the spectrum.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The spectrum is sampled in the energy domain, and all binning parameters will be in energy units.
The spectrum is sampled in the frequency domain, and all binning parameters will be in frequency units.
The spectrum is sampled in the wavelength domain, and all binning parameters will be in length units.
The spectrum is sampled in the wavenumber domain, and all binning parameters will be in wavenumber units.

attribute.title: spectrum_format
attribute.description: The spectrum_format attribute is required to define the specific dimensionality of the structure or substructure that contains the intensity values.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: Linear spectrum - each row of the table contains the information for one bin (one point) on the spectrum. You must specify the name of the field containing the intensity information.
The spectrum is presented as a 2D array - an image.
The spectra are presented as a 3D array, each plane containing a 2D spectrum.

The spectra are presented as a table in which each row contains a single spectrum, and the individual spectral points and related parameters are each defined by separated Field definitions - that is, no Group_Field classes are used in defining the spectral data format. In this case, all Fields containing spectral data or bin parameters must have field_number attributes.

The spectra are presented as a table in which each row contains a single spectrum, and Group_Field classes are used to define the fields corresponding to the spectral values, bin centers, and bin widths (if present). Each Group_Field must contain only a single parameter - in other words, the spectral values a stored contiguously within the record, the bin centers are stored contiguously within the record, etc. In this case, the Group_Field classes containing the spectral values, bin centers, and bin widths (when present) must contain only a single Field that is repeated.

The spectra are presented as a table in which each row contains a single spectrum, and a single Group_Field class is used to define the value and all related parameters at a single spectral point. In this case, the same Group_Field class must contain the spectral value, bin center, and bin width (when present) for each point in the spectrum.

attribute.title: value_field_name
attribute.description: The value_field_name attribute is required for 1D (linear) spectra. 1D spectra are presented as a table, where each row presents one point in the spectrum. This field must contain a string corresponding to the 'name' attribute of the table field that contains the spectral value.

attribute.title: value_field_number_list
attribute.description: The value_field_number_list attribute is used only in the case spectra in the format "Tabulated-Flat", where each row of a table contains a spectrum and the spectral points are defined as individual Fields - one Field defined for each point. The format is a parenthesized, ordered list of the field_number values from the Field definitions that correspond to the spectral values.

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: axis_name
attribute.description: The axis_name attribute contains a string that matches the axis_name attribute in the associated array-type spectrum object; or the special values "Field" and "Row" for tabular and tabulated spectra.

attribute.title: bin_width_energy
attribute.description: The bin_width_energy attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in energy units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: first_center_energy
attribute.description: The first_center_energy attribute provides the value at the center of the first bin along the spectral axis of a spectral data object in energy units.

attribute.title: last_center_energy
attribute.description: The last_center_energy attribute provides the value at the center of the last bin along the spectral axis of a spectral data object in energy units.

attribute.title: sampling_base
attribute.description: The sampling_base attribute indicates the numeric base of the associated logarithmic sampling interval.

attribute.title: sampling_interval_energy
attribute.description: The sampling_interval_energy attribute provides the spacing of points, in energy units, at which data are sampled and at which a value for an instrument or data parameter is available. This sampling interval can be either the original (raw) sampling or the result of some resampling process.

attribute.title: sampling_scale
attribute.description: The sampling_scale attribute indicates the type of scale that applies to the sample interval increments. It must have a value of either Linear or Logarithmic.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The sampling intervals are linear with respect to the physical values they represent.
The sampling values are logarithms of the physical values they represent.

attribute.title: axis_name
attribute.description: The axis_name attribute contains a string that matches the axis_name attribute in the associated array-type spectrum object; or the special values "Field" and "Row" for tabular and tabulated spectra.

attribute.title: bin_width_frequency
attribute.description: The bin_width_frequency attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in frequency units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: first_center_frequency
attribute.description: The first_center_frequency attribute provides the value at the center of the first bin along the spectral axis of a spectral data object in frequency units.

attribute.title: last_center_frequency
attribute.description: The last_center_frequency attribute provides the value at the center of the last bin along the spectral axis of a spectral data object in frequency units.

attribute.title: sampling_base
attribute.description: The sampling_base attribute indicates the numeric base of the associated logarithmic sampling interval.

attribute.title: sampling_interval_frequency
attribute.description: The sampling_interval_frequency attribute provides the spacing of points, in frequency units, at which data are sampled and at which a value for an instrument or data parameter is available. This sampling interval can be either the original (raw) sampling or the result of some resampling process.

The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.
attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

This sampling interval can be either the original (raw) sampling or the result of some resampling process.
attribute.unitId: AU, Angstrom, cm, km, m, micrometer, mm, nm

attribute.description: The sampling_scale attribute indicates the type of scale that applies to the sample interval increments. It must have a value of either Linear or Logarithmic.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The sampling intervals are linear with respect to the physical values they represent.

attribute.title: axis_name
attribute.description: The axis_name attribute contains a string that matches the axis_name attribute in the associated array-type spectrum object; or the special values "Field" and "Row" for tabular and tabulated spectra.

attribute.title: bin_width_wavenumber
attribute.description: The bin_width_wavenumber attribute provides the width of a bin along a spectral axis in a spectral object, in wavenumber units. The method used to calculate the width must be specified using the bin_profile_description attribute. This attribute can be set to 'nil' if bin widths are unknown.

attribute.title: comment
attribute.description: The comment attribute is an unlimited length, format-preserved, UTF-8 text field for comments relevant to the context in which it appears.

attribute.title: first_center_wavenumber
attribute.description: The first_center_wavenumber attribute provides the value at the center of the first bin along the spectral axis of a spectral data object in wavenumber units.

attribute.title: last_center_wavenumber
attribute.description: The last_center_wavenumber attribute provides the value at the center of the last bin along the spectral axis of a spectral data object in wavenumber units.

attribute.title: sampling_base
attribute.description: The sampling_base attribute indicates the numeric base of the associated logarithmic sampling interval.

attribute.title: sampling_interval_wavenumber
attribute.description: The sampling_interval_wavelength attribute provides the spacing of points, in wavenumber units, at which data are sampled and at which a value for an instrument or data parameter is available. This sampling interval can be either the original (raw) sampling or the result of some resampling process.

attribute.title: sampling_scale
attribute.description: The sampling_scale attribute indicates the type of scale that applies to the sample interval increments. It must have a value of either Linear or Logarithmic.

PermissibleValue.valueMeaning: The sampling intervals are linear with respect to the physical values they represent.
The sampling values are logarithms of the physical values they represent.
